instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Have this Macbook air 820-3437 with no working keyboard and trackpad. board is light liquid damage.
Have tray a know good trackpad, keyboard and cable but still not working.

measurement on j4800:
Pin 19: 3,4V
Pin 14: 5,15V
Pin 10: 2,13V

R4830 2.09V and 0,1Ω diode mode give 0.367

Have test with a usb bluetooth mouse and that work

will test if it work when pressing down options button when startup.Nothing happens when pressing options button at startup just booting as normal.

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: Corrosion under J4800 or leaking C4800 ....

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
No, that would fry R4830.

Is there 3V on R8050? If not check 3V on R5294 pin 1 (yes it is not on the board but test that pin)

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
R8050 Pin 1 give 3,34V and 0.2Ω 
R5294 Pin 1 give 3.41V

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: So, 3V present at R8050 and not at R4830. They are on the same rail, there is your problem.

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: Could it bee a bad chip between this? Bade trace? Should i run a wire from r8050 too r4830?

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Duke: Are you sure, don't you mean R8000 and not R8050?

R8050 is the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS 
R8000 is the PP3V3_S4 Rail

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: My guess is something wrong with U8000 or R8000

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: C8000 give me 3.3V and R8000 give me 2.13V

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: It may also be something wrong after R4830, if you remove it and you get 3.3V you know where to look. C4800 or trackpad connector next.

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: Thank you XooP. will remove R4830 and check. report after

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: There may be other places where the voltage on the rail can be pulled down, but you need to start somewhere

threads.title: 820-3437 keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Yeah I meant R8000. 

If S4_PWR_EN is present then it could be short on the bus or dead U8000.
